p: Ferric reducing antioxidant power assay was used to assess the total antioxidant capacity (TAC) of blood samples [ 37]. TAC was quantified by the reaction of phenanthroline and Fe 2+ using a spectrophotometer at 520 nm. TAC is defined as the amount of antioxidants required to increase the absorbance by 0.01, in 1 mL of blood sample at 37 Â°C. Concentration of MDA in the serum, as an index of lipid peroxidation and oxidative stress, was determined using the thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) method [ 37]. The principle is that TBARS reacts with MDA to form a stable pink color that could be measured spectrophotometrically at 532 nm. The values of MDA were expressed as (nmol/mL).
